column4: how do you check if you port is being forwarded in transmission ?
you go to edit->preferences and the network tab should have a "Check Port" button
so, really simple?
it doesn't seem to work properly unless you actually have an active torrent going though
generally, yeah
I have had weird issues with slow seeding and downloading
port is closed ?
it sounds like you haven't forwarded the port, do you have access to the router you're connected to?
also, is uPnP enabled in the Transmission preferences?
well when my neighbor comes home, we are sharing internet
upnp?
it's a way for Transmission to automatically ask the router to forward the port
however, if you're just using the modem provided by your ISP, you probably won't be able to forward the ports and whatnot
I shall look for it
yes upnp it's marked off for
does that mean it's on or it's off?
there is an option "pick a random port everytime transmision is started"
it would be tricky to open a port?
if you have upnp, you shouldn't have to do anything to open the port, however, if you don't, it's a little bit tiresome changing it, yes
I hope upnp will work then
like I said, if you have your own router, it shouldn't be a problem, it's the ISP provided modems that are generally a pita
